name.text: Calculating the Volume of a Triangular-Based Pyramid

questiontext.text:
The figure below shows a pyramid with a triangular base. The base of the triangle measures \({@b@}\,\text{m}\), the height of the triangle is \({@h_tri@}\,\text{m}\), and the vertical height of the pyramid is \({@H@}\,\text{m}\). Find the volume of the pyramid.

\(\text{Volume}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{m}^3\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Given:

Base of triangle, \(b = {@b@}\,\text{m}\)
Height of triangle, \(h = {@h_tri@}\,\text{m}\)
Vertical height of pyramid, \(H = {@H@}\,\text{m}\)

  1. Compute the area of the triangular base:

    \( \begin{align} \text{Base area} &= \frac{1}{2} \times \text{base} \times \text{height of triangle} \\ &= \frac{1}{2} \times {@b@} \times {@h_tri@} \\ &= {@Base_area@}\,\text{m}^2 \end{align} \)

  2. Compute the volume of the pyramid using \(V = \frac{1}{3} \times \text{Base area} \times \text{vertical height}\):

    \( \begin{align} V &= \frac{1}{3} \times {@Base_area@} \times {@H@} \\ &= {@V@}\,\text{m}^3 \end{align} \)

Therefore,
The volume of the pyramid is \( {@Volume_pyramid@}\,\text{m}^3\)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The Base of the triangle}={@b@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The Vertical height of the triangle}={@h_tri@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The base area}={@Base_area@}\,\text{m}^2\)

\(\text{The Volume of the pyramid}={@V@}\,\text{m}^3\)
